alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:32PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Vernon Parish in west central Louisiana and northeastern Newton Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 432 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leesville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leesville, Anacoco, Toledo Bend Dam, Fort Polk, Slagle, New Llano, Hornbeck, Hutton, Burr Ferry, Kurthwood, Simpson, Evans and Pickering. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
